resume.skillmessage: I'm a tinkerer and am always interested in playing around with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

education.school: College of Engineering and Technology, Bhubaneswar

education.description: Secured 10 CGPA in Secondary Graduation and 91.2% in Higher Secondary Graduation.

Experience.title: GirlScript Summer of Code 2020 Winner
Experience.description: GirlScript Summer of Code is a three-month-long Open Source program during summers conducted by GirlScript Foundation, with an aim to help beginners get started with Open Source Development while encouraging diversity. Throughout the program, I contributed to various projects under the guidance of experienced mentors. Most of my contribution is to the project *GirlScript Website Boilerplate* and for which I have secured a spot as the top contributor to the project. During this time I contributed to over 5+ projects utilizing my skills in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React. Through my contributions, I secured a total of 1030 points and became the *second top* Performer in the program which lasted for 3 months.

Experience.title: Hack For Women 2020 Special Prize
Experience.description: Our Team Virus Vixens recognized as the Special Girls Only Team at the GirlScript Summit Hackathon - Hack For Women 2020 organized by GirlScript India Summit 2020 and GirlScript Foundation.Our Project is based on Women Safety. We have created a website for the safety of women mainly who face problems/assaults while traveling.

Experience.title: Among Top 25 contributors
Experience.description: STUDENT CODE-IN is founded with a vision to promote all-round information to those keen students who are here in the globe finding a way for their obstacle. I got a chance to contribute to one of the projects in StudentCode-in named Awesome Portfolio Website. The tech stacks used here is Git, HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

Experience.company: Contributor's Hack organised by HakinCodes Network
Experience.title: Top 5 contributor
Experience.description: Contributor's Hack is an annual Open-Source Program organized by HakinCodes that unites students, developers, engineers, and innovators from different places and culture to be a part of one and a half months of learning and contributing to Open-Source Projects for building their skills and learning how to collaborate and work together in a dev community. I got a chance to participate in Contributor's Hack, 2020 organized by HakinCodes during the last 2 months. It was an amazing journey; I got to learn a lot from other participants and the mentors were really supportive. I worked on a project named Doc2Pen.

testimonials.text: I have had the opportunity to work with Tim on multiple occasions which has always been a pleasure. He is driven and motivated with a consistently positive attitude. Tim excels at communicating with others and is always willing to work hard until he solves the problem at hand.
testimonials.user: Alastair Beaumont - Web Developer at AppColony
